docs.lead_paragraph: We rejoice that we can now announce an entire cession of the Cholera in our village. We make this statement from information derived from the only true sources, viz.: The records of the Board of Health and of the Sexion. From these it appears, that during the last eight days, we have had but two deaths, both children, one two years and the other seven months old.

headline.main: SUMMER PLACES;; The Porch of the White Mountains--A Pleasure Quarter ?? no Fashionable--A Retreat--The Religion of the Place-- ?? Traveling

docs.lead_paragraph: North Conway is the most beautiful antechomber in the White Hills. The traveler should pause here, before entering their polron Courts, to refresh his mind and prepare for the magnificent. experience which awaits it. The little mountain walled village,

docs.lead_paragraph: FURTHER ARRIVAL OF EMIGRANTS-THE CHOLERA.-The Admiral, from Havre, arrived opposite Quarantine on Tuesday, with 351 passengers. She had cholera on board, and some twenty passengers died on the voyage. They were pretty healthy until the ship was 22 days at sea when sickness broke out.

headline.main: FROM HAVANA.; Secret Instructions relative to Slave Property--The Bombardment of Greytown, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: The order alluded to in my last should be qualified as secret instructions, not be published in the usual way, "for general information," authorizing the officers, registers, and "captains of partidos," who had charge of the recent registration of the slaves throughout the Island, to revise and correct the same, by permitting planters and other owners of slave property to hand in "new lists," giving all their negroes.

headline.main: MURDER OF A SEAMAN..; Brutal Conduct of the Officers of the Ship Yorkshire--Coroner's Inquest and Verdict of the Jury Against the Captain, First and Third Mates, and Boatswain.

docs.lead_paragraph: Yesterday Coroner WILHELM held an inquest, at the New-York Hospital, upon the body of NICHOLAS COOK, formerly a seaman on board the ship Yorkshire, one of the Black Ball line of packet ships running between this City and Liverpool. The inquest occupied a considerable time.

docs.lead_paragraph: The following will interest a large class: National Holidays. To the Editor of the London Times: SIR: The few practical remarks I addressed to you on "The Sunday and Days of Recreation," have called very general attention to the subject among commercial men.

docs.lead_paragraph: We have often urged the necessity of driving beyond the thickly settled parts of the City those departments of business which are necessarily accompanied by unpleasant smells. We would not any less earnestly plead the exclusion from the resident parts of the metropolis those which are grievously offensive from their noise.

headline.main: Later from Havana--Arrival of the Cahawba.

docs.lead_paragraph: The U. S. Mail steamship Cahawba, R. W. SHUFELDT Commander, arrived Yesterday, from Mobile and Havana, Aug. 9 and 12.
docs.snippet: The U. S. Mail steamship Cahawba, R. W. SHUFELDT Commander, arrived Yesterday, from Mobile and Havana, Aug. 9 and 12.
